data.title: Lyle Lovett
data.meta_description: News about Lyle Lovett, including commentary and archival articles published in The New York Times.
data.text:
Texas Monthly

A Long Way From Church Street but Still in Sync

Lyle Lovett and Robert Earl Keen talk about meeting and sharing their musical dreams as Texas A&M students in the 1970s — and why working together is a joy for them both.

By Andy Langer

Music Review

A Gathering of Good Friends With Lightning Fingers

Covers of the songs of others, and the stories of how he discovered them, were a large part of Lyle Lovett’s concert Tuesday at the New York Society for Ethical Culture.

By Jon Pareles

The Texas Tribune

Lyle Lovett on Theaters With Magic

Lyle Lovett looks back at historic theaters in Galveston, San Antonio and Austin where he has performed in the past and where he will return on his current tour.

By Andy Langer

The Lyrics? Pretty Familiar. The Performer? Less So.

As a singer and guitarist in his own right, John Hiatt has never drawn as much attention when interpreting his songs as others have.

By Jacques Steinberg

Critics’ Choice

New CDs

Reviews of new releases by Lyle Lovett, Joe Nichols, Jacky Terrasson and Every Time I Die.

By The New York Times
